result.execSummary:
The defendant Lavonte Ivory McElroy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Lavonte Ivory McElroy is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Lavonte Ivory McElroy was found guilty of Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>5-15g), a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)2.
  • Lavonte Ivory McElroy was found guilty of Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: count 2 in 15CF1927 and consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 37 days time served.
- 12 month Drivers license suspension is imposed as to Count 1.

miscConds.notes:
- Fine is set at ZERO.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
- Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Cash bail to apply. Any remaining balance due no later than 12-31-16 or civil judgment to be entered.
- Seek/Maintain fulltime employment/school or a combination of both.

- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
- Defendant may not live where a firearm is kept. 
- Defendant may not be in any automobile where a firearm is present.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes  section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: Firearm possession and Voting.

- Defendant is not to possess cash currency in an amount greater than $200.00 at one time.
- No possession of more than one cell phone at any one time.
- Defendant my not have more than one phone number registered to your name at one time.
- No contact with Gas Station at 4427 N. Greenbay Ave., Milwaukee, WI.

- Court ordered Defendant to comply with all child support court orders.
- Mental Health Evaluation and any recommended treatment. 
- Court recommends Trauma Informed Mental Health Treatment.

Court advises the Defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the Defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The Defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to extended supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the Defendant being returned to prison.

- Maintain Absolute Sobriety: No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.  
- Department of Corrections must conduct drug and alcohol testing at least 1 time per month for the first year of probation.
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.

timeConds.notes: Court ordered defendant to serve 12 MONTHS CONDITION TIME, forthwith, in the House of Correction without goodtime credit; release for The Day Reporting Center and inmate work assignments. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: count 1 in 15CF1927 and consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 37 days time served.

timeConds.notes: - Court ordered defendant to serve 9 MONTHS CONDITION TIME, in the House of Correction without goodtime credit; release for The Day Reporting Center (if eligible) and inmate work assignments. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. This condition time is imposed and stayed.

Deputy court clerk: TMK

Letters on behalf of the defendant received and filed. tk

Defendant Lavonte Ivory McElroy in court with attorney Gilbert Fielding Urfer.  Defendant Lavonte Ivory McElroy in custody.  Paul Michael Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 1-
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 4 YEARS, concurrent with 2 in 15CF1927 and consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 37 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  

AS TO COUNT 2-
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 2 YEARS, concurrent with 1 in 15CF1927 and consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 37 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEAR.  
Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program. 

COURT STAYED THE SENTENCES and placed defendant on probation for 3 YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:

AS TO COUNT 1:
- Court ordered defendant to serve 12 MONTHS CONDITION TIME, forthwith,  in the House of Correction without goodtime credit; release for The Day Reporting Center  and inmate work assignments. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. 

AS TO COUNT 2:
- Court ordered defendant to serve 9 MONTHS CONDITION TIME,  in the House of Correction without goodtime credit; release for The Day Reporting Center (if eligible) and inmate work assignments. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. This condition time is imposed and stayed. 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION AND CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:

- Maintain Absolute Sobriety: No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.  
- Department of Corrections must conduct drug and alcohol testing at least 1 time per month for the first year of probation.
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- Defendant is not to possess cash currency in an amount greater than $200.00 at one time.
- No possession of more than one cell phone at any one time.
- Defendant my not have more than one phone number registered to your name at one time. 
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
- Defendant may not live where a firearm is kept. 
- Defendant may not be in any automobile where a firearm is present. 
- Seek/Maintain fulltime employment/school or a combination of both. 
- No contact with Gas Station at 4427 N. Greenbay Ave., Milwaukee, WI. 
- Court ordered Defendant to comply with all child support court orders.
- Mental Health Evaluation and any recommended treatment. 
- Court recommends Trauma Informed Mental Health Treatment. 
- Fine is set at ZERO.
- 12 month Drivers license suspension is imposed as to Count 1. 
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
- Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Cash bail to apply. Any remaining balance due no later than 12-31-16 or civil judgment to be entered. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

The Court informed the defendant of requirements and penalties applicable under s. 941.29(1m) or (4m).

Court advises the Defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the Defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The Defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to extended supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the Defendant being returned to prison. 

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Lavonte Ivory McElroy in court with attorney Gilbert Fielding Urfer.  Paul Michael Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court addresses the re-testing results which came back as positive.  Arguments heard regarding bail.  Court does not forfeit bail at this time.  However, Court REMANDS defendant into custody pending sentencing.   Parties agree to move the sentencing date from the currently scheduled date of January 15, 2016 to January 4, 2016 at 1:30 p.m.  Oral statements will be done on the day of sentencing and Court will accept written statements the morning of January 4, 2016.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 4, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Re-test test results from 12-10-2015 received and filed. tk

Defendant Lavonte Ivory McElroy in court with Attorney Gilbert Fielding Urfer.  
Danielle Chojnacki for Paul Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

**WALK-IN, CASE HEARD WITHOUT CIRCUIT COURT FILE**

Matter before the Court to address JusticePoint violation.  Defendant tested positive for illegal substance on today.  Defendant is challenging results and submitted payment for confirmation test.  Statements made by defense and the state.  The Court takes no action on today.  The Court withholds decision as to bail pending results of confirmation test, however if results are not filed by the next date the will still consider the state's bail argument.  Filed, JusticePoint Violation Report.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for December 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report dated 11-23-2015 received and filed.

Defendant Lavonte Ivory McElroy in court with attorney Gilbert Fielding Urfer.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
AS TO COUNT 3: On motion of the State, court  ordered count 3 dismissed but read in.

TRIAL DATE WAS NOT VACATED ON THE RECORD AND NEEDS TO BE PUT ON THE RECORD ON THE SENTENCING DATE.

On motion of the State, Court ordered count 2 amended to 961.41(3g)(am), 939.50(3)(i) contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) a Class  I Felony.   Defense counsel waived reading of the Amended Information and entered a plea of not guilty as to count 2 on behalf of defendant.

AS TO  COUNTS 1-2: Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.
